```java
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.TreeMap;

public class ItemPrices {
    private TreeMap<String, Double> prices = new TreeMap<String, Double>();

    public void readFromFile(String fileName) {
        File file = new File(fileName);
        try {
            Scanner sc = new Scanner(file);
        } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        while (sc.hasNextLine()) {
            String line = sc.nextLine();
            Scanner sc2 = new Scanner(line);
            while (sc2.hasNext()) {
                String item = sc2.next();
                Double price = sc2.nextDouble();
                prices.put(item, price);
            }
            sc2.close();
        }
    }
}
```
Explanation:

Instead of using a `Scanner`, we can use the `StringTokenizer` class to read the file line by line and extract the item name and price. We can create a `Scanner` object for each line and use the `StringTokenizer` to extract the item name and price. We can then use the `put` method of the `TreeMap` to store the item name and price.

Note that we need to close the `Scanner` objects for each line to ensure that the resources are properly released.
